documentContentReferences.name: Schedule of Activities Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Multiple references to the Schedule of Activities (SoA) in Section 1.3 and Table 1 for study procedures and timing.

documentContentReferences.name: Dose Modification Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Cross-reference to dose modification or discontinuation criteria for managing adverse events like elevated transaminases.

documentContentReferences.name: Study Assessments Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from the amendment summary regarding clarification of study procedures for US sites.

documentContentReferences.name: Adverse Event Procedures Reference
documentContentReferences.sectionTitle: Adverse Events: Definitions and Procedures for Recording, Evaluating, Follow-up, and Reporting
documentContentReferences.description: Multiple references to procedures for recording, evaluating, and reporting AEs and SAEs.

documentContentReferences.name: Contraceptive Guidance Reference
documentContentReferences.sectionTitle: Contraceptive Guidance and Collection of Pregnancy Information
documentContentReferences.description: Reference to appropriate contraceptive methods for study participants.

documentContentReferences.name: COVID-19 Vaccine Risk Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference to potential risks and mitigation measures due to COVID-19 vaccine.

documentContentReferences.name: Adaptive Features Table Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference to Table 4 describing adaptive design features of the study.

documentContentReferences.name: Dose Modification Table Reference
documentContentReferences.sectionTitle: ALXN1840 Dose Modifications for Individual Participants
documentContentReferences.description: Reference to Table 7 for criteria on when a dose should be decreased or interrupted.

documentContentReferences.name: Exclusion Criteria Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Lifestyle Considerations regarding blood donation restriction prior to screening.

documentContentReferences.name: Discontinuation Criteria Reference
documentContentReferences.sectionTitle: DISCONTINUATION OF STUDY INTERVENTION AND PARTICIPANT DISCONTINUATION/WITHDRAWAL
documentContentReferences.description: Reference to Section 7 for QTc withdrawal criteria and participant discontinuation.

documentContentReferences.name: Clinical Laboratory Tests Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference to the list of clinical laboratory tests to be performed.

documentContentReferences.name: Lost to Follow-up Definition
documentContentReferences.description: Reference to the definition of 'lost to follow-up' for SAEs.

documentContentReferences.name: Genetic Testing Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference indicating that retained samples will not be used for genetic testing.

documentContentReferences.name: Copper and Molybdenum Measurement Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference to details of copper and molybdenum measured in food, drink, urine, and feces.

documentContentReferences.name: Pharmacodynamics/Biomarkers Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference to details of pharmacodynamic and biomarker assessments.

documentContentReferences.name: Analysis Populations Table Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference to Table 8 which defines the population sets for analysis.

documentContentReferences.name: Investigator's Brochure Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Multiple references to the external Investigator's Brochure for risk information and nonclinical data.

documentContentReferences.name: Study Schematic Figure Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference to the study schematic figure.

commentAnnotations.text: Addition of text to the footnote to state that procedures specific to screening sites (only in the US) detailed in Section 8
commentAnnotations.sourceSection: PROTOCOL AMENDMENT SUMMARY OF CHANGES TABLE

commentAnnotations.text: Abbreviations: ALT = alanine aminotransferase; AST = aspartate aminotransferase; IB = Investigatorâ€™s Brochure; PK = pharmacokinetics; WD = Wilson disease.
commentAnnotations.sourceSection: Table 3: Potential Risks and Mitigation Strategy

commentAnnotations.text: Abbreviations: CRF = case report form; CRU = clinical research unit; EOS = End of Study; SoA = Schedule of Activities.
Abbreviations: ICF = informed consent form; PD = pharmacodynamic; PK = pharmacokinetic.

Note: total molybdenum and PUF molybdenum concentration-time profiles on Day 28 after the last 15 mg ALXN1840 dose will be extrapolated to Day 29 (0-24 hr) and subtracted from the observed Day 29 concentration-time profiles after the first 30 mg
